document.docAuthor: Li, Yang, Achterberg, Cornelis Van & Chen, Xue-Xin
document.masterDocTitle: Two genera Campyloneurus Szépligeti and Iphiaulax Foerster in China, with the descriptions of fourteen new species (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Braconinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two genera Campyloneurus Szépligeti and Iphiaulax Foerster in China, with the descriptions of fourteen new species (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Braconinae)

figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 36. Iphiaulax impostor (Scopoli, 1763). ♀. a. fore wing; b. hind wing; c. mesosoma, lateral view; d. mesosoma, dorsal view; e. metasoma, dorsal view; f. hind leg, lateral view; g. head, front view; h. head, dorsal view; i. head, lateral view; j. scapus outer side, lateral view; k. apex of antenna; l. apex of ovipositor, lateral view.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 35.
Iphiaulax impostor ( Scopoli, 1763 )
, ♀, habitus lateral.

FIGURE 36.
Iphiaulax impostor ( Scopoli, 1763 )
. ♀. a. fore wing; b. hind wing; c. mesosoma, lateral view; d. mesosoma, dorsal view; e. metasoma, dorsal view; f. hind leg, lateral view; g. head, front view; h. head, dorsal view; i. head, lateral view; j. scapus outer side, lateral view; k. apex of antenna; l. apex of ovipositor, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Biology. The hosts are mainly species of Buprestidae and Cerambycidae ( Coleoptera ), plus two species of Cossidae ( Lepidoptera ) (
Yu et al. 2016
); in China reared from larva of
Saperda populnea (Linnaeus, 1758)
and
S. carcharias (Linnaeus, 1758)
( Coleoptera : Cerambycidae ).
